intro: Saurauia leytensis, commonly known as the Leyte saurauia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, clustered in umbels, and bloom during the rainy season. Saurauia leytensis is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
